item.title: Hyundai Grand i10 Nios, Venue, And Verna Receive New Variants And Features As Part Of MY25 Updates - CarDekho
item.description:
Hyundai Grand i10 Nios, Hyundai Verna, And Hyundai Venue Get New Variants And Features, Prices Revised By Up To Rs 36,000

Date: October 2023 | Source: CarDekho.com

The year 2025 has begun, with Hyundai introducing model-year updates for the Grand i10 Nios, Venue, and Verna. These updates include new variants, enhanced features, and price adjustments.

  • The Grand i10 Nios now includes a new Sportz (O) variant with improved features.
  • Price increases for specific variants range from Rs 16,000 to Rs 36,000.
  • The Venue has expanded its variant lineup with the new SX Executive manual variant.
  • The Verna introduces more affordable automatic variants, improving their features.
"The S(O) turbo DCT variant of the Verna is now Rs 91,000 cheaper, enhancing affordability."

The overall updates enhance the value proposition and feature offerings across Hyundai's lineup.

item.title: Dollar up as US 10-yr yield hits 8-1/2 month high on tariff report By Reuters - Investing.com
item.description:
Dollar Rises as US 10-Year Yield Reaches 8.5 Month High on Tariff Speculations

Publication Date: January 4, 2023 Source: Reuters

The U.S. dollar rose for the second consecutive session as bond yields increased following news that President-elect Donald Trump is considering new emergency measures for tariffs. The 10-year U.S. Treasury note yield reached its highest level since April.

  • The yield on the 10-year Treasury note rose to 4.73%, the highest since April 25.
  • Trump's potential tariff program could include universal tariffs on various countries.
  • Investors remain optimistic about possible deregulation and tax cuts but worry about inflation reacceleration.
  • ADP's employment report showed a decrease in private payroll growth, while weekly jobless claims hit an 11-month low.
  • The dollar appreciated by 0.28%, reaching a value of 109.00 against a basket of currencies.
"This feeds into this whole theme of a strong dollar and even with the disappointing ADP (employment data), the dollar is still firmer on the day," said Marc Chandler, chief market strategist at Bannockburn Global Forex.

The ongoing trends suggest that the dollar could maintain its strength amid escalating tariff discussions and economic policy changes.

item.title: Gold googly bamboozles import data - The Hindu
item.description:
Gold Imports Cause Major Revision in India's Import Data

Published: January 08, 2025 11:23 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

India's import bill for November 2024 has undergone a significant $6 billion revision, largely due to lower than expected gold imports which have raised concerns among economists about the accuracy of trade data.

  • India's import bill revised from $70 billion to $63.86 billion for November 2024.
  • $5 billion downward revision attributed to gold imports, which were revised to $37.4 billion from $49.1 billion.
  • This change reflects a dramatic shift, marking a mere 13.5% rise compared to the previous year instead of a 49% spike.
  • Overall cumulative import figure for 2024-25 dropped to $472.5 billion, a decrease of nearly 3%.
  • Trade deficit for November revised down to around $31.8 billion from the earlier $37.84 billion estimate.
“The government must explain the rationale behind the revision to ensure India’s economic data retains credibility among investors and financial markets.” - Ajai Srivastava

This substantial revision in India's trade data raises questions about the reliability of economic indicators and highlights the importance of transparent reporting.

item.title: Fed Minutes to show details on decision to trim rates by 25 bps - FXStreet
item.description:
FOMC Minutes: Fed Officials Adjust to Upcoming Trump's Policies

Publication Date: December 2024
Source: FXStreet

Some Federal Reserve officials have incorporated assumptions about potential trade and immigration policy changes under President-elect Donald Trump into their projections, indicating a need for a careful approach.

Key Points

  • GDP growth projected to be slightly lower with a higher unemployment rate.
  • Rate cut of 25 basis points anticipated at the December meeting.
  • Officials expect inflation to move towards 2%, with effects of policy changes likely to prolong the process.
  • There is an increased upside risk to inflation noted by officials.
“Based on my estimate that monetary policy is not far from a neutral stance, I prefer to hold policy steady until we see further evidence that inflation is resuming its path to our 2% objective,” - Beth Hammack

In conclusion, the discussions reveal a cautious outlook as the Fed anticipates the implications of Trump’s policies on the economy and inflation.

item.title: Heineken's United Breweries halts beer sales in Indian state over pricing - Reuters
item.description:
Heineken's United Breweries Halts Beer Sales in Telangana Over Pricing Issues

Date: January 8, 2023
Source: Reuters

Heineken-owned United Breweries has ceased beer supply in Telangana due to unapproved price increases, leading to significant financial losses for the company.

  • Operations in Telangana declared 'unviable' by the company.
  • 15-20% of United Breweries' beer sales come from Telangana.
  • A state panel is reviewing the pricing hike request following the company's announcement.
  • United Breweries requested a 33.1% price hike, which the state refused.
  • The company's shares fell by 7% after the news.
“Despite our continuous efforts over the past two years, there has been no increase in the base prices offered for our products.” - United Breweries

This situation is causing a potential beer shortage, with liquor dealers starting to stock up amid concerns over supply disruption in the state.

item.title: Here are Sebi's new guidelines for independent advisers, research analysts | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Sebi Introduces New Guidelines for Independent Advisers and Research Analysts

Publication Date: 16 December
Source: Live Mint

The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has tightened rules for independent advisers (IAs) and research analysts (RAs) to enhance transparency and protect investors. The new guidelines include tiered deposit requirements and restrictions on the scope of advice.

Key Points:

  • Sebi has set a tiered deposit structure for IAs and RAs, based on client numbers.
  • New registration guidelines allow RAs to also seek certification as IAs.
  • IAs must restrict their advice to securities and disclose non-Sebi products to clients.
  • A revised fee structure offers greater flexibility in charging fees.
  • Qualification requirements for new RAs have been updated to include relevant professional qualifications.
  • Enhanced KYC and record-keeping procedures are mandated for RAs.

Notable Quotes:

"The guidelines aim to ensure better segregation of services between independent advisers and research analysts."

Conclusion:

The implementation of these guidelines is expected to foster greater accountability and transparency in the advisory sector, benefiting investors in the long run.

item.title: Stocks to Watch on January 9: Tata Motors, BHEL, Hindalco, Manappuram Finance and more - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stocks to Watch on January 9: Tata Motors, BHEL, Hindalco, Manappuram Finance and more

Publication Date: January 9, 2025

Source: CNBC TV18

This article highlights significant stocks to monitor today, including Tata Motors, BHEL, Hindalco, Manappuram Finance, and more.

  • Tata Motors: Jaguar Land Rover saw mixed performance with a 3% increase in wholesale volumes YoY and 3% decline in retail sales YoY.
  • BHEL: Successfully commissioned the first two units of a hydroelectric project in Bhutan.
  • Hindalco: Announced a plan to offer $500 million in senior unsecured notes to repay borrowings and fund corporate purposes.
  • Manappuram Finance: RBI lifted restrictions on Asirvad Micro Finance, allowing loan sanctions to resume.
  • Lupin: Received an Establishment Inspection Report from the US FDA for its manufacturing facility.
  • MOIL: Imposed a penalty for exceeding production limits at its mine.
  • ACME Solar: Commissioned an additional 90 MW of solar power capacity, bringing total operational capacity to 2,453 MW.
  • PN Gadgil Jewellers: Reported 24% YoY revenue growth for Q3 FY25.
  • Anand Rathi Wealth: Considering issuing bonus shares in an upcoming board meeting.

item.title: Gold sets forth winning streak with Trump considering emergency tariffs and Fed Minutes ahead - FXStreet
item.description:
Gold Prices Rise Amid Economic Uncertainty from Trump and Fed Minutes

Publication Date: January 8, 2025 Source: FXStreet

Gold prices continue their upward momentum, supported by rising yields and geopolitical dynamics, as President-elect Donald Trump considers enacting emergency tariffs.

  • Gold prices have increased for the second consecutive day driven by economic news.
  • Trump is contemplating a national economic emergency to implement universal tariffs.
  • The ISM Services Prices Paid index has surged, influencing gold market behavior.
  • Key economic indicators are expected from the Federal Open Market Committee.
“I believe inflation will continue to cool toward the central bank’s 2% target.” – Christopher J. Waller, Federal Reserve Board Member.

The current trends in gold pricing reflect not just market behaviors but also the anticipated actions of the incoming president, indicating a volatile economic landscape ahead.

item.title: US stocks dip after jobs data & economic emergency report, quantum-computing shares tumble on Nvidia CEO remarks | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
US Stocks Dip After Jobs Data and Economic Emergency Report; Quantum-Computing Shares Tumble

Publication Date: January 8, 2025

Source: Live Mint

US stock indices fell on Wednesday amid softer-than-expected jobs data and a report regarding a potential economic emergency declaration by President-elect Donald Trump.

  1. The ADP National Employment report revealed that 122,000 jobs were added in December 2024.
  2. The Dow Jones Industrial Average declined by 117.37 points, or 0.28%, to 42,410.99.
  3. Quantum-computing shares saw significant losses following comments from Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang about the technology being decades away.
  4. Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller indicated expectations for further rate easing in 2025.
  5. Gold prices increased by 0.5% due to weaker jobs data.
“I don’t expect tariffs that are possibly coming under President-elect Donald Trump to have a significant or persistent effect on inflation.” - Christopher Waller

The decline in stock prices reflects ongoing economic concerns, especially in the tech sector following critical commentary on emerging technologies.

item.title: Trade Setup for January 9: Nifty bulls see a ray of hope after defending 23,500 ahead of TCS results - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Nifty Index Shows Resilience at 23,500 Mark Ahead of TCS Earnings

Date: January 9, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

The Nifty 50 index bounced back from lows after a sluggish start, managing to hold 23,500. The market sentiment remains cautious amidst global pressures.

  • The index fell initially but recovered to close down by only 19 points at 23,689.
  • Global cues and disappointing US job reports led to selling in broader markets.
  • Reliance Industries and IT stocks supported the index, with IT sector recovering significantly.
  • Important earnings season kicks off with TCS results expected soon, despite ongoing challenges.
  • Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) were net sellers, offloading significant equity shares.
  • Technical analysts suggest the Nifty's short-term trend is weak, but a closure above key resistance levels could signal a potential recovery.
"Despite adverse global cues, managing to defend the 23,500 level provides comfort to bulls," – Market Analyst

Overall, while immediate challenges remain, there's cautious optimism with opportunities for recovery if key levels hold.
